<p><b>Thomas L. Magnanti</b> (born 1945) is an American engineer and <a href="/wiki/Institute_Professor" title="Institute Professor" class="mw-redirect">Institute Professor</a> and former Dean of the <a href="/wiki/MIT_School_of_Engineering" title="MIT School of Engineering" class="mw-redirect">School of Engineering</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology" title="Massachusetts Institute of Technology">Massachusetts Institute of Technology</a>. Magnanti is currently President of the <a href="/wiki/Singapore_University_of_Technology_and_Design" title="Singapore University of Technology and Design">Singapore University of Technology and Design</a> established in collaboration with MIT.</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Biography">Biography</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Thomas_L._Magnanti&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Biography">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Magnanti received an undergraduate degree in <a href="/wiki/Chemical_Engineering" title="Chemical Engineering" class="mw-redirect">Chemical Engineering</a> from <a href="/wiki/Syracuse_University" title="Syracuse University">Syracuse University</a> (1967) and master's degrees in both Statistics (1969) and Mathematics (1971) from <a href="/wiki/Stanford_University" title="Stanford University">Stanford University</a>, where he also received his doctorate in <a href="/wiki/Operations_Research" title="Operations Research" class="mw-redirect">Operations Research</a> (1972).<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>Dr. Magnanti is <a href="/wiki/Institute_Professor" title="Institute Professor" class="mw-redirect">Institute Professor</a> and former Dean of the <a href="/wiki/MIT_School_of_Engineering" title="MIT School of Engineering" class="mw-redirect">School of Engineering</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology" title="Massachusetts Institute of Technology">Massachusetts Institute of Technology</a>. He has served on thesis committees for approximately 70 doctoral students, supervising over 25. He is slated to be the president of Singapore's fourth university, <a href="/wiki/Singapore_University_of_Technology_and_Design" title="Singapore University of Technology and Design">Singapore University of Technology and Design</a> when it opens in 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>Magnanti has been Editor-in-Chief of the journal <a href="/wiki/Operations_Research" title="Operations Research" class="mw-redirect">Operations Research</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>Magnanti is a member of the <a href="/wiki/National_Academy_of_Engineering" title="National Academy of Engineering">National Academy of Engineering</a> and the <a href="/wiki/American_Academy_of_Arts_and_Sciences" title="American Academy of Arts and Sciences">American Academy of Arts and Sciences</a>. He was a founding co-director of MIT's Leaders for Manufacturing Program (now the <a href="/wiki/MIT_Sloan_School_of_Management" title="MIT Sloan School of Management">Leaders for Global Operations</a> program) and the <a href="/wiki/System_Design_and_Management_(MIT)" title="System Design and Management (MIT)">System Design and Management (MIT)</a> program.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span>[</span>4<span>]</span></a></sup> He is a past President of the <a href="/wiki/Operations_Research_Society_of_America" title="Operations Research Society of America" class="mw-redirect">Operations Research Society of America</a> (ORSA) and of the <a href="/wiki/Institute_for_Operations_Research_and_the_Management_Sciences" title="Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences">Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences</a> (INFORMS).<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span>[</span>5<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>He has received honorary doctorates from <a href="/wiki/Link%C3%B6ping_University" title="Link?ping University">Link?ping University</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Universit%C3%A9_de_Montr%C3%A9al" title="Universit¨¦ de Montr¨¦al">Universit¨¦ de Montr¨¦al</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Universit%C3%A9_Catholique_de_Louvain" title="Universit¨¦ Catholique de Louvain" class="mw-redirect">Universit¨¦ Catholique de Louvain</a>. He has also won the MIT Billard Award and ORSA <a href="/wiki/George_E._Kimball" title="George E. Kimball">George E. Kimball</a> Medal for distinguished service.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6"><span>[</span>6<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Work">Work</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Thomas_L._Magnanti&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Work">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Magnanti's teaching and research interests are in applied and theoretical aspects of large-scale <a href="/wiki/Optimization_(mathematics)" title="Optimization (mathematics)" class="mw-redirect">optimization</a> and <a href="/wiki/Operations_research" title="Operations research">operations research</a>, specifically on the theory and application of large-scale optimization, particularly in the areas of <a href="/wiki/Flow_network" title="Flow network">network flows</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nonlinear_programming" title="Nonlinear programming">nonlinear programming</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Combinatorial_optimization" title="Combinatorial optimization">combinatorial optimization</a>. He has conducted research on such topics as production planning and scheduling, transportation planning, facility location, logistics, and communication systems design. He is also known for pioneering an educational philosophy that combines engineering and management.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7"><span>[</span>7<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_awards">Other awards</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Thomas_L._Magnanti&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Other awards">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul>
<li>Journal Networks: Glover-Klingman Prize| best paper published during the year (2005)</li>
<li>American Academy of Arts and Sciences: Fellow (2000)</li>
<li>Operations Research Society of America: Lanchester Prize| Best Publication in Operations Research (1993)</li>
<li>National Academy of Engineering: Member (1991)</li>
<li>MIT: Irwin Sizer Award for Significant Innovations in MIT Education (2001)</li>
<li>Link?ping University: Honorary Doctorate</li>
<li>University of Montreal: Honorary Doctorate</li>
<li>Universit¨¦ Catholique de Louvain: Honorary Doctorate</li>
<li>The Technion: Honorary Doctorate</li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Publications">Publications</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Thomas_L._Magnanti&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Publications">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul>
<li><i>Applied Mathematical Programming</i></li>
<li><i>Network Flows: Theory, Algorithms and Applications</i></li>
<li>Lagrange and Fenchel Duality Are Equivalent, Mathematical Programming, 7, 253-258, 1974.</li>
<li>Network Design and Transportation Planning: Models and Algorithms (with R. T. Wong), Transportation Science, 18(1), 1-55, 1984.</li>
<li>Extremum Properties of Hexagonal Partitioning and the Uniform Distribution in Euclidean Location (with M. Haimovich), <i><a href="/wiki/SIAM_Journal_on_Discrete_Mathematics" title="SIAM Journal on Discrete Mathematics">SIAM Journal on Discrete Mathematics</a></i>, (1), 50-64, February 1988.</li>
<li>Separable Concave Optimization Approximately Equals Piecewise Linear Optimization (with Dan Stratila), IPCO Proceedings, Lecture Notes in Computer Science, 3064, 234-243, 2004.</li>
<li>Strong Formulations for Network Design Problems with Connectivity Requirements (with S. Raghavan), Networks, 45 (2): 61-79, 2005.</li>
<li>An Intersecting Tree Model for Odd-Diameter-Constrained Minimum Spanning and Steiner Trees (with Luis Gouveia and Cristina Requejo), Annals of Operations Research, 146: 19-39, 2006</li>
<li>Variable Disaggregation in Network Flow Problems with Piecewise Linear Costs (with K. Croxton and B. Gendron), Operations Research 55 (1):146-157, 2007.</li>
</ul>
